intro: Uragoga dallachiana, commonly known as the Dallachian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually small, with bright yellow or orange petals, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
